page.title: 04HOUSING IN LAWRENCE WESTON
page.content: Before 1948, there were only{fields and{woodland}in Lawrence Weston. Bristol needed more homes, so the Council decided to build a new housing estate. It was built with families in mind. All the houses have{gardens}and the flats have grassed areas around them. Most{houses}have 3 bedrooms, 2 reception rooms, kitchen and bathroom, and most{flats}have 2 bedrooms, living room, kitchen and bathroom.{Garages were built in blocks away from the houses as few people had cars. The {Council owned}all the homes, but some tenants have bought theirs. Recently many{private houses}with garages have been constructed, with between 1 and 4 bedrooms. Some owner-occupiers have had{extensions}built and/or renewed their{windows and doors}with aluminium or UPVC. Weston Park School
